Key Match Events: Victor Wembanyama had 11 points in the third quarter to turn the tables on the Minnesota Timberwolves.
Donte DiVincenzo grabbed the rebound but only went 1-for-2 from the charity stripe to give the Timberwolves a 112-110 edge.
Jeremy Sochan missed a potential game-winning 3-pointer.
Post-Match Reflections: Victor Wembanyama and the San Antonio Spurs have been on the road since Dec. 23. They opened their swing away from Texas with a 111-106 loss to the Philadelphia 76ers.

On Christmas Day, Wemby put on a show in front of a jam-packed Madison Square Garden crowd, but the Spurs lost 117-114 to the New York Knicks. Two nights later, they finally won one road game when they held on to beat the Brooklyn Nets 96-87.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The San Antonio Spurs went to Wembanyama for the final shot but the Timberwolves defense held up. Julius Randle wouldn't give him an inch, forcing Wemby to give up the ball late.
Others: Victor Wembanyama and the San Antonio Spurs finished with a 1-3 road record
Victor Wembanyama and Co. close out 2024 with a home game on New Year's Eve against the LA Clippers.
